en: To hit it off with smth
To put your foot in it (to have done / said something inapproptiate)
ex: Example: I really put my foot in it when I asked her how her parents were doing. I forgot they had divorced last month.

en: To cc smb in (on an email)
ru: Функция в емейле для того, чтобы отправлять кому-то письмо при этом показывая, что он не главный получатель. Главный юскейс – отправление кому то копии письма. Образовано от carbon copy.
Поставить в неловкое положение – c un Успокоить кого-то – без

ex: Пример: Я давно не играл в игры и потерял контакт с игровой индустрией

en: To relate to smb (to understand the feelings of smb)
ex: Пример: It’s hard for me to relate to her as I’ve never been in this kind of situation.
Пример: Социальная мобильность помогает людям повысить уровень своей жизни и получить больше выгод = Social mobility allows people to increase their level and get more benefits
Пример: учителя всегда жалуется/выражает недовольство/сетует на подчерк учеников = Teachers often complain about students’ handwriting

en: Write off / to cross smth out
ru: Вычеркнуть из чего-то. Забивать на что-то. Списывать со счетов (в смысле забить на человека)

ex: Пример: I had 40 emails in the inbox this morning.
Пример: I understand that I’ve been in the wrong and wounded your feelings.
Пример: Pouring a shot of Jagermeister, I said to myself: “You need to get your drinking under control” = Разглядывая шот Ягермейстера я сказал себе: “Ты должен взять свою зависимость под контроль”
Пример: My boyfriend was typing a message for too long, so I lost my temper and called him = Мой бойфренд писал сообщение так долго, что я потеряла терпение и позвонила ему.
Пример: This ancient streets are excellent for soaking up the atmosphere of this town = Эти древние стены идеально впитали в себя атмосферу этого города
Пример: Stunning news shocked the society = Потрясающие новости потрясли общественность

ru: Прилагательное, что-то типа более туристический, больше наполнен туристами
ex: Пример: The square becomes much more touristy after nightfall = Площадь становится более наполненной туристами после наступления ночи
Пример: I really like oranges out of season = Я действительно люблю апельсины вне сезона
Пример чет не очень: However hard you try to rough it, you can’t do without some water = (Перевод GT) Однако если вы попытаетесь сделать это грубо, вы не сможете обойтись без воды

ru: Обратиться к кому-либо (видимо от слова апеллировать)
ex: Пример (тут два немного разный смысл)

en: Such an approach as I think to appeal all experts = Такой подход чтобы понравиться всем экспертам
ru: Farmers have appealed to the government for help = Фермеры обратились к правительству за помощью

ex: Пример: I just suggest you wander off the beaten track to discover the beauty of the islands = Я просто предлагаю вам покинуть проторенную дорогу, что-бы увидеть все красоты острова.
Пример: Jordan was such a blowhard - he was apt to boast of his knowledge all the time = Джордан был таким утомительным – он был склонен хвастаться своими знаниями все время.
Пример: Iceland is known for the wildlife and the northern lights = Исландия известна своей дикой природой и северными сияниями.
Пример: The beautiful scenery can fascinate everyone = Красивые пейзажи могут восхитить каждого
Пример: I feel very anxious when I was in a crowd = Я был очень взволнованным, когда был в толпе
Пример: I felt really bitter when Pete cancelled the meeting with me and met another person = Я почувствовал себя очень горько, когда Пит отменил встречу со мной и встретил другого человека
Пример: It seems he takes great delight in watching birds = кажется он с большим удовольствием наблюдает за птицам
Пример: We must increase the company’s level of production to improve the miserable state of affairs = мы должны повысить уровень производства компании чтобы улучшить жалкое положение дел.
Пример: I was puzzled when I heard about the derivative for the first time = я был озадачен, когда первый раз услышал о производной
Пример: I was delighted that she had decided to stay a little bit longer = я был рад, что она решила остаться немного дольше
Пример: The State Tretyakov gallery showcases unrivalled art pieces = Третьяковская галерея демонстрирует непревзойденные произведения искусства

ru: Быть пропитанным чем-то. Например, о том что мясо надо пропитать в чем-то перед готовкой

ex: Пример: We were planning something at the waterfront and it went wrong when my brother and his girlfriend got arrested = мы планировали, что-то на набережной, когда мой брат с его подругой были арестованы
Пример: Sunday nights, I need to unwind with my favourite book = Ох воскресные ночи, мне надо расслабиться с моей любимой книгой.

ru: Центр или самая важная часть страны

ex: Пример: Rublevka is an affluent area in the north-west of Moscow = Рублевка – это богатый район на северо-западе Москвы

ru: О строениях или районе, который был процветающим, но теперь в плохом вид, обветшалый район

ex: Пример: Here, in Brazil, muggings and thefts are part of everyday life
Пример: Success doesn't just spring up out of nowhere. You must work towards it
Пример: A severe snowstorm took me by surprise in the woods = Сильный шторм застал меня врасплох
Пример: In the late hours you can fully enjoy the vibrant nightlife of Moscow = В ночные часы вы можете в полной мере насладиться оживленной ночной жизнью Москвы
Пример: I can’t stand that humid tropical heat = Я терпеть ну могу эту влажную тропическую погоду
Пример: John was heavily fined and in default of payment might be condemned to doing time = Джон был сильно оштрафован и если не заплатит то, будет обречен на отработку
Пример: Modern scientists recognize conspicuous consumption as the disease of the new generation = Современные ученые понимают потреблядство как болезнь нового поколения
Пример: We were almost the last ones left because the bus driver was crawling along the road like a snail. = Мы оказались почти последними, потому что водитель автобуса полз по дороге как змея
Пример: That Winder Girl has a spotless reputation = Эта Чудо-Девушка имеет безупречную репутацию
Пример: Many people in India are living in unsanitary urban slum = Много люди в Индии проживают в антисанитарных городских трущобах
Пример: The club nearby is full of buzz at any time of day = Клуб рядом полон шума постоянно в любое время для
Пример: My perfect arguments in political science classes made my opponent choke on theirs = Мои идеальные аргументы на уроке политологии заставили моего оппонента подавиться своими

ru: Выбрасывать / бросать (в этом контексте о мусоре)
ex: Пример: Don’t drop litter in public places = Не бросайте мусор в публичных местах

Пример: A radiator was working for a long time, that is why I entered a room from winter outside and hit  a heatwall = Радиатор работал долго, поэтому когда я вошел в комнату с наружи, где была зима, я ударился об стену тепла

en: To get the hang of smth
ex: Пример: I’m 25 already, I still can’t get the hang of living alone = Мне уже 25, но я все еще не могу понять, как жить одному
Пример: The first semester is about to get underway = Первый семестр скоро начнется
Пример: Seeing you in a hat already had me in stitches = Твой вид в шапке уже заставил меня сильно смеяться
Пример: Joy was wild with laughter at listening to his friend’s jokes = Джой была безумна от смеха, слушая шутки своего друга.

ru: Комедийный фильм, в котором гиперболизируют физические способности человека (что то типа ударов, которые слышны за много километров)
ex: Пример: “Dumb and Dumber” is such a slapstick comedy movie = Тупой и еще тупее пример такой комедии

en: To get the scare of one’s lives
ex: Пример: I got the scare of my live when this midnight doorbell rang! = Я испугался за свою жизнь, когда пробило полночь

en: To get to the bottom of smth (=to understand the very nature of the problem)
ru: Понять проблему изнутри, с самого низа, изучить досконально

en: To be at the somebody’s expense (=to happen because smb else paid for it, either with money or something else)
ex: Пример: Jimmy is a jerk - he was trying to cash in at her expense
Пример: Why are you still awake at this ungodly hour?

en: To get a word in edgeways
ru: Вставить слово поперек / не могу сказать ни слова

ex: Пример: Commendable contribution = похвальный вклад
Пример: I have to wake up at the crack of dawn = Я должен проснуться на рассвете
Пример: It is common for a student at HSE to be sleep-deprived
Пример: It was an inopportune moment to confess your love = Это был неподходящий момент, чтобы признаться в любви

en: To be the laughing stock of society
ex: Пример: It is thought that dissidents are the laughing stock of society = Считается что диссиденты – посмешище общества

ru: Быть плоской (о шутке, типо плоская шутка)
ex: Пример: Despite the fact that he did his best, most of his jokes fell flat.

ru: Кататься по полу от смеха, оглушительно смеяться
Быть привлеченным к ответственности / предстать перед судом

ex: Пример: Many people do not believe that justice has been served in his case.
Пример: Daily car use figures just continue to soar

en: To commit a minor offence/a felony

ex: Пример: Any miscarriage of justice is irreversible

en: To back down from a cause / to shy away from a cause
To secure a slim majority (to get as many votes as required (but not more) to overpower the opposing party)

ex: Пример: He warns the liberal party against any attempts to seize power

en: To arise (to happen / come into being)
ex: Пример: Will you study abroad, if the opportunity should arise?
Пример: He should act as a go-between in trying to bring the two sides closer together

en: To impose sanctions (to put limitations on another country / body’s economic activity)
ex: Пример: The Security Council also decided to impose sanctions on all natural fuels supplied from Russia.

en: To bow to pressure (=to make a decision under pressure)
ru: Решать под давлением, склоняться под давлением
ex: Пример: Israel will not bow to pressure from the USA = Израиль не склониться под давление США

en: To deliver a speech (to give a speech)
ex: Пример: You shouldn’t have forced him to deliver a speech, he is a really good public speaker

en: To rule smth out (=to exclude smth from consideration)
ex: Пример: You have to do the blood test in order to rule out the infection.

en: To be on the brink of smth (to be about to do smth)
ru: Почти решиться сделать что-то / Находиться на грани действия
ex: Пример:  Both countries are on the brink of returning to war, when the numerous innocent people were killed.
Пример: Japan’s prime minister, Shinzo Abe, vowed to put an end to the Kuril Islands dispute.
Пример: The Government of the USA has reported a death toll of this terrorist attack exceeding 20 people
Пример: The government plans to bar drinking in public places.

en: To pull out off smth (e.g. a contract, negotiations)
ex: Пример: Gnomeregan  decided to pull out of strategic arms limitation treaty with Stormwind

en: To go bust (to become bankrupt [about a company])
A payout (an amount of money you pay to smb)
ex: Пример: They are just looking for a payout from the company
Пример: Many girls and guys have to give up the dream of becoming a flight attendant on health ground
Пример: The goalkeeper is still out of action with a thigh strain

en: To land smth (i.e. to get yourself smth)
ex: Пример: In the past six months they have landed some profitable contracts

en: To be on the go (to travel to and from because of work)
ru: Быть постоянно в пути по работе
В целом согласована/быть в основном согласным с…

ex: Пример: We have no doubt that our leader was a man of the highest integrity
Пример: Ostensibly, she had achieved all her main goals
Пример: Celebrity endorsements are one of the most effective ways of  attracting public attention
Пример: It is nearly impossible for foreigners to blend in with the community.
Пример: The foliage of the trees may turn yellow and red in autumn
Пример: Julia sneaked a Valentine’s day card into his bag and slipped away
Пример: My duty was supposed to be to reconcile THE differences on the family issues.
Пример: These actions are carried out by use of force, pressure and trickery.

ru: Улучшиться (можно, например, о здоровье так сказать)
ex: Пример: His mom won’t let him hang out until his health has picked up quite a lot
Пример: He was laid off last week = Он был уволен на прошлой неделе
Пример: She was taken on as an accountant.
Пример: The expansion of economic activity was driven by a considerable upturn in domestic demand.
Пример: It was necessary for the company to make redundancies in order not to go bust = Компании необходимы были увольнения чтобы не стать банкротом
Пример: The factory is small, so THE overheads will be low = Фабрика маленькая так что накладные расходы будут низкими

en: To put a positive spin on situation
ru: Пересказать ситуацию так, чтобы она окрасилась в положительные цвета
ex: Пример: Throughout history politicians always managed to put a positive spin on massacre

en: To be au fait with something
ru: Быть знакомым с чем-то (например, о правилах игры)
ex: Пример: Actually, I’m not au fait with Russian rap culture = На самом деле я не разбираюсь с Российской рэп культурой

ru: Слова или действия, которые социально не верны или грубы
ex: Пример: The only one tiny faux pas she made at the dinner party disgraced her for the rest of her life
Пример: Guerilla fighters are one of the main components of a successful war
Пример: The narrow streets in Venice are full of stalls with kitsch
Пример: In some old abandoned castles you can really feel the zeitgeist of the medieval times
Пример: Anna here, she’s a do-gooder: she would fall over herself to lend you her coat

ru: Дай этому шанс / попробовать сделать что-то
ex: Пример: I think it's a great chance to fix our miserable financial situation, why don't we give it a go?
Пример: Some members of the meeting were trying to undercut the boss’s authority
Пример: Not only do we have to determine our sales targets, but we ALSO need to exceed them to be a profitable company
Пример: Our success is down to our persistence and precise planning.
Пример: He might be bluffing because he is not sure whether to raise the bid
Пример: LM Corporation discusses a hostile takeover of other firms.

en: To affect the company’s bottom line
ex: Пример: The new trading policy affected the company's bottom line because of incorrect projections of costs

ru: Переходная зона между чем-то и чем-то
ex: Пример: There is a grey area between clearly legal and strictly illegal
Пример: Representatives from both sides met late last night in an attempt to settle an industrial dispute between the workers and the employer.

ru: Во много раз (в два раза, в три раза и т. д.)
ex: Пример: The changing of battlefield tactics has increased our chance of winning manifold
Пример: Putin responded in kind to Trump’s decision to go out of an Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty by pulling out of all nuclear agreements
Пример: Most of the Israeli friends of Hannah Arendt were dead against publishing that famous book.
Пример: It is clear that this violent film has an adverse effect on children’s  psyche

ru: Головная боль настолько сильная, что ослепляет
Похлопать по плечу или, например в зале (про аплодисменты)
ex: Пример: He patted his best friend on the shoulder in an attempt to support him
Пример: Augustus and Hazel had a good time in Amsterdam, but after their return to Indianapolis Gus suffered a relapse and was taken to hospital

en: To be put on a drip
In the run up to something
ex: Пример: In the run up to the exam I was too nervous

en: To have a falling-out over something
ex: Пример: Adam and John had a falling-out over his late mother’s car
Пример: Apple’s annual turnover stands at around $15 billion
Пример: Charlie had undergone surgery to increase his intelligence, but it brought happiness neither to him nor to a little white mouse

en: To bring about a sweeping/far-reaching change
ex: Пример: With assistance from the local Christian organization, he hoped to bring about a sweeping change in people’s mentality.
Пример: When things turned sour for a young Buddhist acolyte, he burned down the Golden Pavilion and became one of the most famous arsonists in Japan
Пример: After spending twenty-seven years in solitude and silence, Christopher Knight DID manage to adjust to living on his own.

ru: Поменять чье-то поведение (только живое существо может повлиять на другого)

en: R&D department = Research and development department

ex: Пример: The main topic of the lesson was how to pass the right information on
Пример: As a boss, I am obliged to pass instructions to all subordinates and it is their duty to act in accordance with that information.
Пример: Since that Chinese hotel was so tremendous I asked the manager to arrange somebody to show me around

ru: Период оплачиваемы для учителя, в который он может заниматься учебой и путешествиями
ex: Пример: Our history of religions professor took a long sabbatical to study Hinduism in India
Пример: My vitality drained away when I realized that I would not get that job
Пример: No sooner had John mentioned having affluent grandparents, he managed to spark my interest
Пример: According to the documents, he set the wheels in motion and after a mere 10 seconds managed to escape the explosion; that is impossible!

en: To be mind-numbingly boring/blissfully happy/fiercely competitive/emotionally draining

ex: Пример: Specialists are needed in this low paid, highly complicated but immensely rewarding job
Пример: If you want to deal with the stock market, you need to find out the intrinsic values of all companies.

en: To quench one’s thirst for something
ex: Пример: Only by studying hard can we somehow quench our thirst for better knowledge of English.
Пример: The  strawberry cake my mom baked smelt so delicious that there was no need to work up an appetite

ru: Противопоставить что-то чему-то, зачесть что-то в споре против чего-то другого

ex: Пример: The inflation rate turned out to be lower than anticipated.
Пример: Working as an actor in the Maly Theatre I get free theatre tickets and other perks
Пример: Both sides were unanimous in their decision to cease the meeting due to the lack of time for preparations
Пример: Sheltered upbringing affected my self-esteem, as now it is hard for me to realize myself and live a life beyond my limits.
Пример: Different non-governmental organizations help children with deprived backgrounds whose parents can’t afford even secondary education
Пример: After the establishment of the soviet regime many intellectuals decided to flee the country.
Пример: As soon as Forest Gump was enlisted in the US Army he was sent to see active service in Vietnam.
Пример: After my PC shutdown there was no other way but to start my essay from scratch
Пример: John could be so aggressive because he comes from a broken home, where there were violence and abuse
Пример: A weekend bender can immediately create a close-knit community
Пример: Conversely, Jon Eduardo comes from a privileged background, successfully graduated from Oxford and is supported by his family
Пример: Logan’s family died in an accident so he was made an orphan.
Пример: You can say I have a memory like a sieve, cause I always forget about deadlines right away.

en: To be like chalk and cheese
ru: Быть как сыр и мел (очень разные)
ex: Пример: Kate’s day and night shifts are like chalk and cheese, if you know what I mean

en: To be as tough as nails
ex: Пример: Be careful with Marta. Despite her being 80 she is tough as nails as she has been boxing for 60 years

en: To be as dead as dodo
ru: Не быть популярным или известным теперь

en: To avoid something like the plague
ex: Пример: Lily started avoiding parties like the plague after last year’s incident

en: To trigger the outbreak of something
ex: Пример: Even one hassle between Grove Street and Ballas can trigger the outbreak of a war between two gangs
Пример: Russia’s mistake is its apparent withdrawal of support for the EU

en: To be as hard as nails
ru: Кто-то кто чрезвычайно жесткий и агрессивный

ex: Пример: The Boston massacre was one of the reasons made colonial Americans to start the War for Independence
